PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Agfa Superpan Supreme safety film
CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, National Edition, August 1, 1942, pg. 17, reads: "Courier's Candidate - Josh Gibson, greatest catcher in Negro baseball, who has been nominated by The Pittsburgh Courier as the No. 1 Negro candidate for major league baseball. The Courier has agreed to pay Gibson's expenses to any major league city if he should be granted a trial.  Star of the Homestead Grays, Gibson has been rated by baseball experts as a $200,000 catcher. - Staff Photo."Cutline for image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 17, 1943, pg. 18, reads: "Grays Change Plans; Will Drill in Homestead - Key Men in Camp as Grays and Eagles Tune up for 1943 - As the Homestead Grays launched spring drills at West Field, Homestead, Pa., and the Newark Eagles opened their limbering-up sessions in Trenton, N.J., the three experts of the diamond pictured above were being counted on heavily as key men of the respective rosters.  Josh Gibson, left, homerun king of Negro baseball, looks forward to a banner season with the Grays, champions of the Negro National league..."
TitMainTitle: Homestead Grays baseball catcher Josh Gibson crouched on Forbes Field
